definition: to get out of trouble/to escape from danger/a danger appears/threatened by danger

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Louisa suffered another two poison plot, a fluke of danger.
sentences.chinese: 還，路易莎又遭遇兩次毒殺陰謀，只是幸運出險。

sentences.english: Tourism Chuxian may not necessarily be able to get the full amount of insurance compensation.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊出險後不一定都能得到保險公司的全額賠償。

definition: to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
to apply for (a subsidy, unemployment benefit etc)
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
